org.usefultoys.slf4j.meter

Class Meter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usefultoys.slf4j.internal.EventData
      • org.usefultoys.slf4j.internal.SystemData
        • org.usefultoys.slf4j.meter.MeterData
          • org.usefultoys.slf4j.meter.Meter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class Meter
extends MeterData
implements java.io.Closeable
    At beginning, termination of operations and on iterations, collects system status and reports it to logger. Call start() to produce a 1-line summary about operation start and current system status as debug message and an encoded event as trace message. Call ok() to produce a 1-line summary about operation successful end and current system status as information message and an encoded event as trace message. Call fail(Throwable) to produce a 1-line summary about operation failure and current system status as error message and an encoded event as trace message. Call progress() to produce a 1-line summary about operation progress and current system status as information message and an encoded event as trace message.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Meter

        public Meter(org.slf4j.Logger logger)
        Creates a new meter. Events produced by this meter will use the logger name as event category.
        Parameters:
        logger - Logger that reports messages.

      • Meter

        public Meter(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
             java.lang.String operationName)
        Creates a new meter. Events produced by this meter will use the logger name as event category.
        Parameters:
        logger - Logger that reports messages.
        operationName - Additional identification to distinguish operations reported on the same logger.

      • getCurrentInstance

        public static Meter getCurrentInstance()
        Returns:
        The meter most recently started on the current thread.

      • getLogger

        public org.slf4j.Logger getLogger()
        Returns:
        Logger that reports current system status as information messages.

      • sub

        public Meter sub(java.lang.String suboperationName)
        Creates a new Meter whose name is under the hierarchy of this meter. Useful if a large task may be subdivided into smaller task and reported individually. The new meter uses the name of this meter appended by dot and its own name, similar as logger do.
        Parameters:
        suboperationName - Additional identification appended to this logger name.
        Returns:
        The new Meter

      • iterations

        public Meter iterations(long expectedIterations)
        Configures the meter as representing a task made up of iterations or steps. Such meters are allows to call progress() an arbitrarily number of times between start() and ok()/fail(java.lang.Throwable) method calls.
        Parameters:
        expectedIterations - Number of expected iterations or steps that make up the task
        Returns:
        reference to the meter itself.

      • start

        public Meter start()
        Notifies the meter in order to claim immediate execution start of the task represented by the meter. Sends a message to logger using debug level. Sends a message with system status and partial context to log using trace level.
        Returns:
        reference to the meter itself.

      • inc

        public Meter inc()
        Notifies the meter that one more iteration or step completed that make up the task successfully.
        Returns:
        reference to the meter itself.

      • incBy

        public Meter incBy(long increment)
        Notifies the meter that more of iterations or steps that make up the task completed successfully.
        Parameters:
        increment - the number of iterations or steps
        Returns:
        reference to the meter itself.

      • incTo

        public Meter incTo(long currentIteration)
        Notifies the meter that a number of iterations or steps that make up the task already completed successfully.
        Parameters:
        currentIteration - the number of iterations or steps
        Returns:
        reference to the meter itself.

      • progress

        public Meter progress()
        Allow informing about successful completion of iterations or steps making up the task represented by the meter. Only applicable for meters that called iterations(long i) before calling start(). Sends a message to logger using info level, only periodically and if progress was observed, to minimize performance degradation.
        Returns:
        reference to the meter itself.

      • flow

        @Deprecated
public Meter flow(java.lang.Object flow)
        Deprecated. 

      • path

        public Meter path(java.lang.Object pathId)

      • ok

        public Meter ok()
        Confirms the meter in order to claim successful completion of the task represented by the meter. Sends a message to logger using info level. If a time limit was given and execution exceeded this limit, sends a message using warn level instead. Sends a message with system status and partial context to log using trace level.
        Returns:
        reference to the meter itself.

      • checkCurrentInstance

        public boolean checkCurrentInstance()

      • ok

        public Meter ok(java.lang.Object pathId)
        Confirms the meter in order to claim successful completion of the task represented by the meter. Sends a message to logger using info level. If a time limit was given and execution exceeded this limit, sends a message using warn level instead. Sends a message with system status and partial context to log using trace level.
        Parameters:
        pathId - A token, enum or exception that describes the successful pathId.
        Returns:
        reference to the meter itself.

      • reject

        public Meter reject(java.lang.Object cause)
        Confirms the meter in order to claim unsuccessful completion of the task represented by the meter. Sends a message to logger using info level. If a time limit was given and execution exceeded this limit, sends a message using warn level instead. Sends a message with system status and partial context to log using trace level.
        Parameters:
        cause - A token, enum or exception that describes the cause of rejection.
        Returns:
        reference to the meter itself.

      • fail

        public Meter fail(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Refuses the meter in order to claim incomplete or inconsistent execution of the task represented by the meter. Sends a message with the the exception to logger using warn level. Sends a message with system status, statistics and complete context to log using trace level.
        Parameters:
        cause - Exception that represents the failure. May be null if no exception applies.
        Returns:
        reference to the meter itself.

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Checks if meters the meter has been forgotten to be confirmed or refused. Useful to track those meters that do not follow the start(), ok()/fail() idiom for all execution flows
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • close

        public void close()
        Compliance with Closeable. Assumes failure and refuses the meter if the meter has not yet been marked as confirmed.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
